Question: Samsung S4 Active users: When on the QI charger it does not constantly charge. It charges, stops, charges, stops. Any suggestions?
Answer: I have had that a couple of times and my solution was to remove the back plate and make sure the charging contacts are fullyy engaged. In my specific case I have the charging pad mounted to the underside of my back plate not to the battery. Ive also bent the snout of the charging pad (where the contacts are located) away from the underside of the back plate so when mounting the back plate the contacts can line up better. This is not necessary if youve taped the charging plate to the battery. If youve taped the charging plate to the battery and your confident the charging contacts are fully engaged then I would look to the

Question: Does this case interfere with the phone's NFC connectivity?
Answer: Yes and no. Distancing the phone from the tag and having any form of barrier will decrease the range of the tag. However, unless you've got a glass tag, an implanted tag, or one with an exceptionally low signal to begin with, you'll not notice any difference.

Question: is this compatible with the iphone 5c as well?
Answer: Yes, it works with any Bluetooth A2DP device, however I would not recommend it. I tested and thoroughly compared about 60 different Bluetooth speakers recently. The SHARKK Bluetooth 4.0 speaker is the best bang for your buck, period, and it has double the battery life they list because they upgraded the battery but didn't update the description. Though it's sound is a tad sharp, the Altec Lansing iMW575 speaker is the best waterproof one I've discovered. It's loud and clear but does start to distort at high volume when the battery gets very low, instead of just turning off. Maybe they fixed that with a firmware update. The best non-waterproof speaker hands-down is the Sound Blaster Roar SR20 and it really cranks out awesome, clear sound with sweet bass and amazing battery life. Speakers that support APT-X and AAC audio codecs have clear, uncompressed sound. Skip Bose, except for the Soundlink mini, which sounds very good but is a little soft. Most Bose is way overpriced. The Sony SRX-X7 is awesome but also overpriced and the software, if you choose to use it, is way overcomplicated and buggy.

Question: Can it work in Botswana?
Answer: This coverage maps shows that Orange is a GSM carrier in Botswana, so it should work with an Orange sim card or other carrier with an international data package in the areas shown on the map in this link: http://www.orange.co.bw/mobile/coverage.php However, it looks like mostly 2G GPRS and EDGE data coverage is available, your tablet is backwards compatible to these data services, but it will be slooowww when it works. 3G is available in only a couple of areas according to the map. There may be other GSM carriers but coverage will be likely similar. Even if the service works, make sure to address the costs of using a regional or international data package from the provider before hand. This tablet uses the micro-sim size card, and they may sell local prepaid sim cards in the more populated areas in electronics/cell phone stores, maybe some grocery/convenience stores. The tablet can also connect to WiFi, hopefully there are some free and public hotspots somewhere.

Question: what ear bud and ear hook accessories are included in the package? Online shows several options included but none are mentioned in your description.
Answer: one ear loop and i think 5 ear buds of several sizes are included. I do offer a strong bit of advice I learned a long time ago, go to a local shop that sells high quality hearing aids. bring your blue tooth headset and the ear buds with you. Pick a ear-bud that you wouldn't use I always choose too small of one for me to use. Tell them you want to get a custom earpiece like for a hearing aid. they will put a little piece of foam rubber in your ear and then inject over it into your ear canal a gel that will harden and then pull it out. If your headset has a tube like this one or a piece like many other brands that must rest against your cheek for the noise filtering to work that they understand the position that is REQUIRED for the Bluetooth headset to work properly. They send it with your ear gel off and you typically get it back at their office in about 72 hrs when you go back bring your phone and your bluetooth headset. Make sure you turn your volume way DOWN or it will be like a cartoon when something is loud and blows out the other ear. You will find out that the headset will have the best volume that you ever had and you will be able to jump up and down, you could even lay down and put your head on a pillow and it will stay on and in position! Hope this answer and additional info helps.

Question: if i used HDMI port for tv,Micro USB for charging & regular USB port for game controller.Will all ports work at the same time?can someone test this?thx
Answer: Actually I finally was able to get it to work all at the same time. Follow these steps and you'll probably have success. 1) connect any USB device you want to use, IE keyboard/mouse/etc 2) connect the HDMI cable to the adapter but not to the tv/monitor. Alternatively you can connect to the monitor and not to the adapter. Either way don't connect it to the screen you want to use just yet. 3) connect YOUR charging cable directly from your wall-charger. The cable that was sent with the adapter to provide power must not be high enough quality to power everything and USB does not have enough 'umph' to do it either. 4) plug the adapter into your phone, verify that the phone has recognized your USB device(keyboard/mouse/etc). If not, start over from step 1. If you continue to have issues, your adapter may be defective. 5) now you can connect your HDMI cable to your screen. At first nothing will happen but within 3-5 seconds your phone's screen will turn off and your tv/monitor will turn on. hope this helped.

Question: which way does the spare battery sit in charger?

Question: What is the difference between the Fredom Sprint and the X Sport? For running outside - 5 minles or so, and in the gym, which would you recommend?
Answer: I have owned both pairs in the past 3 months and myself as well as my roomate like how the freedom sprint fits better in our ears. With that being said it may just mean we need to play with the attachments more. However alot of customer reviews on the apple website also state they don't fit their ears as well either. The bluebuds X are a little bigger outward and their center of gravity is outward more and thus they seem to want to fall out of your ear even when oriented in the secure fit orientation. The freedom sprint have two options to fit in the over ear position or inner ear and bluebuds x only fit inner ear style. The secure fit orientation is nice, but IMO it takes way too much adjustment to get it right as I still can't find that sweet spot. Pros: Bluebud X sound is great if you can get it to fit and stay. Also the secure fit gets the cord off your neck which is way better than sticking to your neck when you get sweaty. Cons: Bluebud X is smaller in size, but sticks out too far and may cause ear buds to fall out easier beacause of that. Some people don't like the way they fit in your ear. I'd say freedom sprint in terms of cost and ease of use.

Question: what is the difference between bulk packaged and retail packaged plantronics headset?
Answer: "Bulk packaged" is in fact refurbished. The headset includes a 90-day limited warranty issued by a third party warranty services company specifically for refurbished products. The retail version is brand new and includes a one-year warranty directly from Plantronics. I purchased both a retail version and the bulk version through Amazon at the same time. Examining both units, I also noticed a few small scratches and gouges on the bulk version where the two halves come together, presumably the result of being pried apart to repair the unit. There's nothing wrong with selling refurbished products, but they should be labeled as such. These are being presented as "new" and that is misleading, basically bait and switch.

Question: Why can't I pair my headset with my smart phone? To elaborate, my bluetooth setting on my phone is on. It is in discovery mode. I am searching for the nearby bluetooth devices and nothing can be found. The bluetooth is on and fully charged. I've got...
Answer: Hi, Try this: First make sure that the bluetooth headset is OFF. Then When the bluetooth is off. try pressing the middle button and keep holding it. first the light will turn on flashing. keep ur finger pressed even after that. after like 5-10 more seconds it should become a flashing red & blue light then try to pair it with the cell phone. If your phone asks you for a passcode then enter fours zeros (0000). Let me know how it goes. Thanks... Isaac @ BluetoothPlus

Question: Is this 50,000 mAh battery capable of charging a laptop computer?
Answer: Unless you have special equipment I would say NO. The charge is released by 2 USB ports not from a wall outlet so for a standard laptop that charges by wall outlet you can't plug it in. You would need to convert from DC to AC current and then adapt the plug type from 3 prong to USB. Also the amperage of the charge produced from the larger USB outlet on this device is 5 amps. That is a very slow charge in laptop terms. It would at best slow down your drain rate while the laptop is turned.

Question: Will this work with my s3?
Answer: Only if you have an aftermarket qi charge coil installed over your battery.

Question: will this work for the dell venue 8 (andriod)?
Answer: Hi Alyssa; this device is a transmitter of power in the Qi standard -- Qi is a standard just like "NEMA-5-15" is a standard that describes how your power cords plug into your walls in the USA. This device speaks "Qi". The problem is that I don't see a Dell Venue 8 receiver for the power. Just as Radio has a transmitter (the station) and receiver (your radio, converting radio waves into sound), you need a Qi receiver that converts Qi power into power to charge your battery. I just did a search for "Qi Venue" and found no matches on Amazon; you might have better luck. The key is that "Qi" symbol: make sure that you have a Dell Venue case or adapter for Qi, and this or any other Qi transmitter will work with your Dell.

Question: Will this work with a Samsung note 3, with the QI wireless charging case?
Answer: I have the Samsung Galaxy S4 with the Samsung wireless charging case (QI compatible) and it works great! It charges at 620 milliamps, which is a little faster than over usb charging on a computer and slower than plugging in the cable to the wall directly. I bought 2 - one for overnight charging and one for charging at work in the afternoon. There is only a dim blue light when you start charging, no beeps or noise.

Question: I have a Glxy S3 with a broken power port. Currently I have to remove battery and place on charger. Will this work so I don't have to remove battery?
Answer: If your phone supports qi charging, yes should work for you.

Question: my phone will not keep charging,, it starts but then it stops... what do i do?
Answer: I do not know about your particular phone's charging issues, but with my Samsung Galaxy s3 I learned that the problem (and apparently a common one with Samsung phones) is that the USB recharging port has poor quality soldering. I've ultimately found that a better solution than USB charging or even using the Lerway wireless Qi "drop-pad charger" is to use multiple batteries with wall charging units. I believe I've written a review for such a product - it was around $20 for the charging unit and 2 spare batteries. I ABSOLUTELY LOVE how fast and efficient wall chargers/spare batteries are. I know have 7 spare batteries so I can keep several at home, a few in my office, a few in the car, etc. I can pop out a discharged battery and replace it with a fully charged on in about 15 seconds. Forget USB and drop-pad chargers.

Question: Hi, I don't know if I'm charging my phone, it is currently dead. When I put my phone on the charger the LED light will turn blue, but sometimes it wil blink, or sometimes, blink blue to green, theere is no red like some people are saying. What is...
Answer: When you place your phone on the pad, the indicator light should turn blue for normal operation. The indicator light will occasionally flash Blue/Green once it senses that the phone has reached an adequate charge state. A red indicator light means that there is a problem with either the charger, the battery or both. If your battery is completely dead, and will not take a charge then the battery must be replaced. Never completely let a lithium battery discharge, that will kill it. This is unlikely in your phone, since it has a protective circuit built in to avoid this. It can take 8 to 12 hours to recharge a phone that will not turn on because of a low battery. The other possibility is the recharging receiver built into the phone. If it is defective it may need to be replaced. If the phone will charge with a wired charger then that may be the problem.

Question: Can this wipe an SD card? My SD files were recently deleted and I don't know if this is why.
Answer: ??????? My SD card is intact with no problems. Try researching the problem through Qi technical sites......

Question: Does it connect to the Lumia 920 NFC ability?
Answer: It does, but if the battery is critically low it will not charge.

Question: Does this make the phone warm or heat up during charging?
Answer: I have four different wireless chargers, including this one. The phone/tablet gets slightly (and equally) warm on all of them. However, if you allow the phone/tablet to "daydream" (display clock or other graphic of choice) while wireless charging the phone/tablet gets very warm, even hot. I find this to be equal on all chargers as well. I always push the power button after the phone/tablet starts charging. This stops the dream mode. Also you can disable dream mode in the display settings. I like this particular charger because it's easy to line up the coils and the green/red/blue light is visible from top, end and sides. Bottom line is if your phone/tablet is active while charging, it will get hot. The charger itself doesn't cause the heat.

Question: What US carriers can be used with this cell phone to have a 3g connection in California?

Question: Can I charge this battery back up using a 220v source? (International) Does it say anything on the packaging that it is only 110 or 120v?
Answer: You will need to use a wall charger similar to what you use for an iPhone or iPad. Most of these are rated for 220V. The wall charger converts the input voltage, typically 100-240V, to 5V for the typical mobile device. This powerpak is specified for an input of 5V at 1.5A. Input and output is listed on the wall charger. So check the wall chargers you already have for your mobile devices, most likely they are rated for input voltages ranging from 100-240V, or 110-220V. Output voltage should be 5V. The output amps will typically be 1A or 2A, which tells you the maximum possible current for that charger. Ideally, you want 1.5A, or higher, output for this powerpak to give you fastest charge time.

Question: How does it connect to the ipad/iphone? Via Bluetooth? (which seldom works in my experience) Thanks
Answer: Someone please correct me if I'm wrong, but from what I can tell, the anemometer itself does not use power. When I first used the device, there was no prompt to connect anything using Bluetooth, and the app registered readings right away. The headphone jack piece (which, I believe, is made out of solid plastic) seems to be solely used to attach the device to the iphone/ipad, not to charge or sync the device in any way. Even if you hold the anemometer close to your iphone/ipad without plugging it in, the app will still register the readings. I read that the anemometer uses magnets, so my assumption is that the phone can sense the rotation of the magnets in close range (maybe in the same way it can sense compass readings?). This is all based on my observations, but the packaging lacked any in-depth information so I hope this helps. If you're mainly asking whether or not the app/anemometer has problems connecting, I had no connection issues.

Question: Do we still need double sided tape for the edge or just this LOCA glue would be fine?

Question: Can this be used with the digitizer still in the phone? Has anyone had problems with the buttons sticking after curing? - using a Galaxy S4
Answer: I used this glue to replace the glass only (digitizer still in phone) but I took out all the cameras and sensors first and used double sided adhesive tape as well. I lined the side of the digitizer as well as top and bottom. Lasted the glue on digitizer and set glass on making sure no air bubbles were inside and cured using a UV Lamp from salon edge with no problems on my S4 that I'm using to write this answer to your question. I would say to make sure no glue leaks to places you don't want it to to use the double sided glue and remove sensors and cameras prior to gluing process. Hope this helps

Question: can you change language to english
Answer: From the home screen, press the left dash button for Menu. In the menu tiles screen, go down to the icon that has pink background and a white gears and a wrench for Settings (might be called Configuracion). Hit the left dash button for OK (might be called Acept). In the Settings menu, go down to #3 for Phone Settings (might be called Configuracion del telefono). Hit OK (Acept). In the Phone Settings menu, go down to #2 for Language (Idioma). Hit OK (Acept). In the Language menu, select the top option for English. Hit OK.

Question: How to turn off insert sim message
Answer: This phone has 2 SIM slots, and the "Insert SIM" message shows up for each. If you have no SIMs in, you will see 2 "Insert SIM" messages on the screen. If you only have one SIM in (I assume your case), you will still see an "Insert SIM" message to represent the empty slot, and the other slot will show up on screen as your carrier, like T-Mobile or AT&T. I'm not sure there is a way to turn off the "Insert SIM" message unless you insert 2 SIMs.

Question: how do i change the language from spanish to english

Question: Will this be compatible with all outlet cables? Don't want my outlet to be burned because of over flow of current.

Question: Have read Apple and Android use different techniques for charging; Android follows int'l standard, Apple doesn't. This explain the labels on charger?
Answer: The label and the reason is explained in the Anker product page: USB-charged devices look for a USB pin signal before they accept a full-speed charge. Most devices use a standard USB pin signal; Apple devices and a few others, like the Galaxy tab, require specialized pin signals. Our Android and Apple ports are hard-wired to accommodate these two types of charging authentications. However, an Apple device can (usually) still charge from an Android port and vice versa, sometimes at a slower speed, but oddly, often also at full speed. - See more at: http://www.ianker.com/product/71AN3654W-WA#sthash.S4I7jfEF.dpuf

Question: Does this work on Kindle Fire

Question: Does this fall out of the outlet easily? I am concerned about 4 cords weighting it down.

Question: No overcharge protection?
Answer: According to our product team, all our chargers have a chip inside to prevent overcharge your device. If you can't unplug your device at once after fully charged, there is little effect on your device in normal status. However, if there is abnormal situation occur, such as power cut and then power on in your home while you keeping plug the device on the charger/outlet, it may cause a damage to your device and our charger. Thus, in the long term safety consideration of electronic device, we suggest you unplug your device after fully charged. Really appreciated your understanding towards this matter.

Question: How many amps do you get through the built in micro USB cable?
Answer: The built-in microUSB cable is reported to produce 1A output while the USB connection is capable of up to 2A. See: http://www.easyacc.com/power-bank/p98-easyacc-ichoc-m5-5000mah-dual-ports-power-bank.html (scroll down to "Technical Details" near the bottom). I haven't taken a multimeter to the leads to test these claims, but they seem pretty reasonable.

Question: Will it work with iPad 3
Answer: In a word, "No". It is designed to work with the smaller (iphone, androids) devices that don't draw as much current. This could charge an ipad slowly with the screen off but it does not have the capacity to fully charge an ipad or the amperage to "push" the electricity into the ipad at reasonable speed. You will need a battery with "2.1 amps" port and at least "12,000 mah" to fully charge a ipad 3 from 0%.

Question: Is it comfortable to talk on the phone with the wallet case on for prolonged periods of time? Does the case fold back; where does the magnetic flap go
Answer: The case folds back and there's a magnetic piece inside the back cover that lets it stay in place. You can even fold the small flap back in between the two piece and all 3 magnets will hold it in place. Most cell phones are reallyvsmsll or thin and cramp your hand when holding them too long. This gives you a wider grip. The plastic piece the phone sits in is flush with the edge of the phone too.

Question: The glass by itself has adhesive or I have to stick the glass with the pre-cut adhesive that is in the kit?
Answer: Well, if you haven't removed your cracked glass yet, you will need a heat gun and plastic pry tools and/or molybine super thin wire to separate glass from LCD screen. Very tedious job that needs patience or else you will ruin LCD. If you have a LCD already new with no glass on it, the correct way to put new glass on is with liquid UV loca glue just like it's done from the factory. You can youtube how to do that. If you don't want to use uv glue, you can go easy route and just put the adhesive glass comes with at the top and bottom and the thin pieces on the sides. Be sure not to have any on the actual LCD as it will show when you put glass on.. It's not the rite way but will work. Just the touch function will not work at it's best like uv liquid loca glue that fills gap between LCD and glass.. You can dry the uv liquid glue with a uv black light or uv led flashlight or leave in sun for 30 minutes at a time checking it's dryness. Any questions just email me at AppleRepairMan27@gmail.com

Question: Do I use the entire adhesive or just the outside edge? If inside also, how can I attach it without creating air bubbles?
Answer: Just use the outside edge. Be very careful and take your time and it will look like a new phone. This is not a screen saver. The material it very sticky and hard to handle. If you get in a hurry your going to miss it up. Use only the outside edge. Again take your time and you will have a new phone. I really like the out come of phone, even though I got finger prints on the inside of the screen. I got in a hurry. Not the kits fault. I am ordering another kit now that I am confident in what I am doing. A hot air gun to heat the old adhesive up is a must. Again take your time. If you have any questions contact me.

Question: Does this package have the full screen adhesive?
Answer: 2 sided tape. I didn't use it for the full screen, just the sides

Question: So, is this truly an over the head style, and how does it work in a Gym?
Answer: It's not over the head style. It's over the ear. And, as you can see from its picture, is not stereo. For me, the device stays snugly on my ear even when I bike. I have run with it on over short distances and it doesn't come loose or fall out. It's light enough and snug enough that I think it will be okay for a gym workout although I can't really say how it would hold up for an aerobics or dance class or any activity that requires jumping or acrobatic moves.

Question: Are these sweatproof?
Answer: Mine died in about 6 months of regular use at the gym. I suspect it's due to sweat. Here's their product site. Despite being called "Active2", it doesn't really mention anything about using it in a "active" lifestyle. Just generic bluetooth usability. http://www.brightechshop.com/products/item/2/active2tm-bluetooth-headset-headphones Another issue I had that lead to it dying was that it wouldn't hold a charge for more than a day. Even if I charged it and didn't use it for a day, it wouldn't turn on or only last a few minutes. I had to charge it day of use which was annoying. I've tried contacting them through their site to replace my pair and never got a response. If you're going to use it primarily for workouts/exercise, I'd recommend buying one specified for that activity. If you're still wondering, yes, they worked fine while new. Since they're just earbuds essentially, I did have some issues with it getting loose while running so now I prefer bluetooth headphones with some kind of canal or over the ear support for stability.

Question: Does one have to hold the stylus vertically to write or tap? What does the disc do?

Question: How can I create an account?
Answer: To create an account, click on the 'Sign Up' button on the top right corner of our website and follow the instructions to complete the registration process.

Question: What payment methods do you accept?
Answer: We accept major credit cards, debit cards, and PayPal as payment methods for online orders.

Question: How can I track my order?
Answer: You can track your order by logging into your account and navigating to the 'Order History' section. There, you will find the tracking information for your shipment.

Question: What is your return policy?
Answer: Our return policy allows you to return products within 30 days of purchase for a full refund, provided they are in their original condition and packaging. Please refer to our Returns page for detailed instructions.

Question: Can I cancel my order?
Answer: You can cancel your order if it has not been shipped yet. Please contact our customer support team with your order details, and we will assist you with the cancellation process.

Question: How long does shipping take?
Answer: Shipping times vary depending on the destination and the shipping method chosen. Standard shipping usually takes 3-5 business days, while express shipping can take 1-2 business days.

Question: Do you offer international shipping?
Answer: Yes, we offer international shipping to select countries. The availability and shipping costs will be calculated during the checkout process based on your location.

Question: What should I do if my package is lost or damaged?
Answer: If your package is lost or damaged during transit, please contact our customer support team immediately. We will initiate an investigation and take the necessary steps to resolve the issue.

Question: Can I change my shipping address after placing an order?
Answer: If you need to change your shipping address, please contact our customer support team as soon as possible. We will do our best to update the address if the order has not been shipped yet.

Question: How can I contact customer support?
Answer: You can contact our customer support team by phone at [phone number] or by email at [email address]. Our team is available [working hours] to assist you with any inquiries or issues you may have.

Question: Do you offer gift wrapping services?
Answer: Yes, we offer gift wrapping services for an additional fee. During the checkout process, you can select the option to add gift wrapping to your order.

Question: What is your price matching policy?
Answer: We have a price matching policy where we will match the price of an identical product found on a competitor's website. Please contact our customer support team with the details of the product and the competitor's offer.

Question: Can I order by phone?
Answer: Unfortunately, we do not accept orders over the phone. Please place your order through our website for a smooth and secure transaction.

Question: Are my personal and payment details secure?

Question: What is your price adjustment policy?

Question: will this work on a lg. bh9431pw, 1460w blue ray home theatre system, for plugging in head phones in the front?
Answer: As long as your electronic device has a USB audio input, it will work on basically anything. All it does it allows you to utilize your audio signals as you see fit. For example, in my case (I am a drummer) I simply plug it into one of my many music laptop audio USB inputs and I could use a microphone, headphone, etc. But I primarily used mine to record output audio signals from my laptop music software. I also use it to reroute signals to my Amps and speakers to record music from the built in audio software in my electronic drum kit. I in addition use it to record output signals from microphones positioned in front of my speakers. I don't see any reason why you couldn't use it on your device. Just plug it into your USB audio output on your device and stick in your headphone, it should work.

Question: I too have the same question, do all these accessories come along with standard Box things (Battery,Charger, USB cable) OR it is only Camera + these

Question: can it take pictures right after another?
Answer: Thanks to this question, I just learned something about the camera. When I used the camera recently, I noticed I had to wait about five seconds between shots. I just discovered a button on the back that looks like a target. After taking a picture, I can press that button and shoot again immediately.

Question: Can you turn the camera's sounds off without disabling the flash? If so, how?
Answer: Yes, turn on the camera, press the Menu button. You will see a wrench and hammer icon on the right tab. Press the right button on the control wheel to that icon. There will appear a bunch of options. The first is Mute, the second is volume. Cursor down to the volume, then press the OK button( the one is the middle of the control wheel). This will open up the volume for the various sounds. Just select each one, and press the left button on the control wheel, this will lower the volume on the item selected. Do this to all the sound options. Press the menu button to exit, and you will not have a silent camera that will take flash pictures. I did this on my camera, and had no problems with taking a flash picture. Good Luck David Devlin

Question: What's the best way to stream regular television from this device? Will it work with DirecTV? Does this have a digital tuner built in?

Question: With no audio output, how do you get sound from HDMI sources (cable boxes, Xbox, etc.) to external speakers?
Answer: I actually use an hdmi to component splitter in my setups with this projector, so that hasn't been an issue for me. Could also split off the HDMI to a stereo that accepts it if you have an hdmi splitter.

Question: What do i need to connect external speakers for use with hdmi video signal
Answer: Not sure what your set-up is but we use a dedicated HTPC as audio/video/BluRay source fed through a video card with HDMI-out interface. HDMI cable from PC feeds into an Onkyo Home Theater A-V receiver which processes the audio and video signals from the PC. HDMI-out from A-V receiver feeds video (only) to a projector for viewing movies, internet, photos on a big screen, etc. Receiver plays full 7.2 surround-sound audio for both music and video. Hooked up a separate computer monitor on the DVI-D-out interface coming from the same PC video card to avoid having to turn on the projector for everything. This versatile system offers the best of all worlds for viewing and listening enjoyment as well as internet surfing and general computer use. Everything plays in the highest quality and is right there at our fingertips with a few clicks of the mouse button. We use a dedicated HTPC but the same set-up could be easily achieved with a laptop if it has an HDMI-out. Hope this is helpful.

Question: I am renting a condo and have been given the wifi code to a hotel across the street. (100yd) The signal gets shoddy will this extender work for me?

Question: I can not do connection my Netgear Universal WN3000RP Wi-Fi Range Extender i do not know, could you help me reconnect that

Remember, it gives you a link that is NOT a url. The link connects you to your new extender. After you have established that connection, you get a page with some questions after which you can finish the installation by simply clicking "finish". Question: how do you connect external speakers? Do any settings on the tv have to be changed?
Answer: I assume that when you plug in some headphones into that analog/headphone jack, the TV's speakers go mute automatically; so when you plug in a pair of special RCA cables that have RCA on one end of which you plug into your AMP and that mini pin on the other end of which you would plug into the TV's headphone jack, the same thing will happen, i.e. muted TV speakers. But instead of having headphones, you will have amplified speakers. Then you could set your AMP's volume level to something rather high, and control the volume of the TV through the TV itself using its remote.

Once I boosted the bass to 15 and brought the treble down low, it is so much better. I actually am enjoying it now.

Question: how do you get the lines and creases out of the screen
Answer: Screen has to be fully stretched on all four sides, pulled tightly and secured to the frame. After having done those three things and with the screen being outdoor, the daylight heat should help eliminate the creases. Keep this in mind, heat expands and cold contracts. It is best to tighten the screen against the frame during the hottest time of the day, because when the temperature get cooler/colder, the screen will contract, thus further stretching out the screen and eliminating creases. If you tighten screen against the frame at cooler temperature, when the screen get warm, it will expand thus causing creases and loose ends.

Question: If module removed, machine won't start of course. When module resocketed, will I need a recovery, or will it just work again? (long trip coming up)
Answer: Depends on the encryption being used. If bitlocker then yes as bit locker also detects changes in the bios settings and enabling or disabling tpm chip (via removal) counts. If the chip was removed and not attempted to boot hard drive, and then put back in, shoot work as long as bios settings are the same. But if an attempt is made, it won't matter if bios is the same or not, will prompt for recovery key. I would back up your recovery in advance, then you have nothing to worry about.

Question: My asus Laptop G751JY-DH71 is missing TPM chip, can this be added to my existing laptop to enable Bitlocker?

Question: What is the CD for? Do I need it for BitLocker to work?

Question: Hello! I have a card of the brand Foxconn H61MXV model and I wonder if this module is compatible with it? Thank you.
Answer: Hello Fernando. Other people have successfully installed this TPM module on other manufacture motherboards. As long as that montherboard has a 20 pin TPM header on the motherboard, this should work. The main determining factor seems to be if the motherboard has a socket or just pins sticking up out of the board (like ASUS does). If the motherboard has a socket, you might have a bit of trouble plugging this TPM module in as the PCB board sits down low next to the plug and would prevent it from going into sockets. I found this guys article here very helpful to answer you question -> https://sites.google.com/site/techbobbins/home/articles/gigabyte-motherboard-tpm-compatibility Hope this helps.

Question: what does it mean by "LED Lit" monitor?
Answer: Traditional big box monitors were lit using a Cathode Ray Tube (CRT), which was generally very hot due to the extremely high voltage required to power them. The next generation of monitors (What people typically refer to as "Flat-Screen," but actually the difference was in the Liquid Crystal Display (LCD) vs. the glass projection screen from the CRTs) were much slimmer and took a lot less power to operate; these were lit by Compact Fluorescent (CFL) bulbs, typically found at the bottom but sometimes both bottom and top. To finally answer your question, "LED lit" monitors use Light Emitting Diodes (LEDs) to light up the image you see on the LCD screen. So what you need to understand from an advertising perspective is, if the monitor is being sold as "LCD" then it is likely "lit" by CFL. If the monitor is being advertised as "LED lit," then it is still an LCD but uses LEDs to light up the display. The benefit of "LED lit" is drastically reduced power consumption, as well as brighter back lighting and typically less bleed over on the edges so the blacks look darker.

Question: What do the different lights on the Battery Charge Indicator, and what do they mean??
Answer: The battery indicator button has two(2) functions. 1.When using regular, non rechargeable, alkaline D batteries, and with the correct position of the switch inside the battery compartment, the light will turn "red" when your batteries are low and need to be replaced. 2. The radio has a great feature in that it has a built in NiMH charger. So buy some "good" quality rechargeable D batteries(i.e. Tenergy),insert them properly and move the switch over to the NIMH side inside the battery compartment. Plug in the included AC adapter. NOW the battery indicator button will blink "green" indicating that the internal NiMH batteries that you just installed are charging! When charging is done, takes a while, it will turn a solid green indicating full charge. When the Nimh batteries run low the light will turn red indicating you need to plug in the AC adapter and recharge the NiMH batteries. YOU NEVER HAVE TO BUY BATTERIES AGAIN! ENJOY!

Question: is this what i need to pair my bluetooth headset to my tv
Answer: Yes you can use this for a bluetooth headset to your TV, HOWEVER, you need to make sure your headset has APT-X. Typical bluetooth has a very long delay. You will see the lips move before you hear the words. That will drive you crazy. Bluetooth with APT-X reduces that delay, but does not completely eliminate it. However you will need both the transmitter and receiver to have APT-X. This device can be used as your transmitter from your TV, but your headset ( the receiver ) must also have APT-X.

Question: What BlueTooth version is this? Is it 2.1, 3, or 4? That spec is not listed in the product description.
Answer: I don't have an exact answer for you but I'll tell you what I "suspect": This device uses Bluetooth A2DP, which is "Adanced Audio Distribution Profile", which has to be met independently of any Bluetooth version on your device. For example, I have an older LG phone which meets some basic Bluetooth protocols, yet it also supports A2DP so it could be paired to Bluetooth Stereo speakers, etc. I think if your device supports Bluetooth "Stereo", you're probably okay but it would need to be tested to be sure. Your question prompted me to read into a Wiki article about Bluetooth and it would seem logical that devices which support Bluetooth 2.0 + EDR would be the ones most likely to support audio, based on the wider bandwidth available (2.1 to 3 Mbit/sec) for supporting high-quality audio. The key, though, is to find something that specifically supports A2DP. If the other device supports aptX as well, that is an enhancement to the audio codec which will improve audio quality and reduce the latency of the transmission. (Nice but not necessary on the latter.) Hope this helps a little.

Question: Can I use this device to connect my Smart TV and may Soundbar replacing the HDMI Cable?
Answer: this is an awkwardly worded questions so I will try to answer it in parts. This device connects to any standard 3.5mm audio jack, which the back of your TV should have, as well as be in the back of the source of your sound bar. There is no HDMI cable to connect to this device. My advice, do not replace the HDMI cable from the TV to the sound bar, because you will lose so much audio quality. Instead, what I do is leave the Soundbar system plugged in with HDMI, but turned low/off for my sleeping baby, and I also play the TV sounds through this device connected to my AptX-enabled bluetooth wireless headphones (these are cheap and very simple to use = http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00IBCRZ3Y/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o02_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1), and play as loud as I want.

Question: From where can I find extension cable? and what is the cable size/type for this machine?
Answer: I'm not aware of where you can order cables with the connectors used for this device. However, you should be able to use regular twisted-pair networking cable to add length by splicing it into the provided cable. I'm not sure what length before the signal would degrade, but I would expect you could go 100 feet or more. Just some advice if you splice: don't cut too close to the connectors, in case you need to repair or re-do the splice in the future, you want to give yourself plenty of room (I'd splice at least a few feet from the connectors), AND if you're unfamiliar with splicing cable ask someone who does for tips on making solid connections. I honestly don't know where to get the connectors that they use, but they look like a common style of circuit-board type connectors, so I imagine there are electronic parts retailers or manufacturers that sell them somewhere. 20 years ago, I would have said "go to Radio Shack", but they haven't been much help recently with these kind of things. You should note, the connectors for the cameras are 4 pin, and the connectors for the control line between 2 monitors (if you have 2 monitors) are 5 pin.

Question: How can I extend the cables using cat5e cables?
Answer: Straightforward, simple splicing. If you've ever spliced phone wiring or network wiring, you'll be fine. If you've never done it or feel uncomfortable doing it, ask someone who has done it before to assist you or to show you how. The most important advice is, don't splice too close to the connectors - give yourself plenty of margin for error to cut off the spliced ends if you need to re-do it. (It may be difficult to find replacement connectors if you run out of wire.) I'd splice into the provided connecting cable at least a few feet away from one end.

Question: how do you remove the RP-20 plate from the VH R2 from the tilt head?
Answer: It's very simple. Using the photo of the VH-R2 provided here, you will notice a small lever on the right side of the unit pictured. Using the index finger and thumb of your right hand, grasp and then pinch together the two ends of that lever and then move them in a horizontal direction away from you. By this action the two piece lever will then unlock and release the top RP-20 mounting plate which you will also notice pops up slightly. It can then easily be removed from the VH-R2. I recently purchased this top piece to mount on my Oben ACM-1400 mono-pod which came with a flat non-articulating head. The VH-R2 screws directly on to the original mount head. No tools required. I use it to better stabilize my video camera when taking telephoto shots on the run.

Question: Can I use this chip with a 32-bit operating system?
Answer: To my knowledge you can. Most of the hardware to my knowledge is backward compatible. So if you had a 64-bit processor for instance, you can still run a 32-bit operating systems, you just wouldn't get the speed or efficiency that 64-bit brings. As far as graphics cards, I'm pretty sure the only thing you need to make sure is compatible is your motherboard, and you can find the specs in the motherboard documentation. If you don't have the documentation, search for the motherboards company website, say for instance your motherboard is an Intel motherboard, then search for the Intel website. You will most likely need the model of the motherboard as well.

Question: What is the difference between this one and the 900614 which is $100 cheaper?

My video card is very big and take up a lot of room. For the money, it looks like you have a found a comparable card for $100 less. Question: I have an AMD radeon HD7700; is this a good upgrade? compatible?
Answer: In term of processing power the Visiontek 7870 is great. I run 6 monitors, and have background processes running Litecoin GPU mining and the card ticks along wonderfully. The issue comes when you NEED to run 6 monitors. There seems to be a systemic fault with the cards, reported by many users, where one of the miniDP output blanks intermittantly though regularly (every few minutes) when under load. This is frustrating, very distracting and means you can't reliably use the 6th monitor. Using an MST hub does not fix the problem - the issue seems to be further back in the processing chain than the output itself.

Question: I have 6 televisions in portrait mode (vertically) I need to display a single picture on 3 and a video on the other 3. Will this card work?
Answer: This card is one of the biggest pains to set up. I have been building computers for about 15 years and I have never had as many problems as I had with this one. I normally do not buy AMD, but, with my research, this seemed like it was going to be a home run... there was too much hype with this card. I put this in two separate computers that I was building simultaneously, one with 6 monitors and one with 4. The four works great, but the 6 had to be downgraded since no matter what I did, it wouldnt display correctly on all 6. I tried all different configurations and even bought all six certified converter (DVI to mini display) cables that this card recommended. I think your best bet is that if the TV has mini display to utilize those connections. The key is having active adapters (which I thought would fix my problem when I purchased a total of 6 adapters).

Question: Does the AMD RADEON HD7870 Eyefinity 6 ED Graphic Card support 6 separate programs or applications at one time on each monitor as well?
Answer: Yes, you can have each monitor showing something different. Each monitor can be at different resolution. For example, I have one monitor that is 4k while the other monitors are not. I have some monitors that are the same size and some that are not. I have one monitor that is always playing a movie while the others are doing other things.

Question: Title says "DISC Support". What does this mean?
Answer: It says "M-Disc support". M-Disc is a type of recordable media that doesn't use an organic dye, but rather an inorganic layer. Basically, this is a side standard of optical discs that are designed to not "overdevelop" the way that polaroid photos did. (meant to last and last) The mention of it in the title is just to let you know that among all the other types this drive can use, M-Disc is included.

Question: Does this product work with MacBook Pro? I have OS 10.5.8. Thanks

Note that for a MacBook Pro you won't be able to plug both USB cables (one for data, one for power) without a usb extension cord because the MacBook only has one port on each side, too far apart for the caple supplied to stretch. However, it will read DVDs OK with only one usb connection - I think it only requires the extra power when it's writing.

Question: Does this NAS support VMWare images?
Answer: This will support a VMware image over a LAN connection, I would suggest using the aggregated ethernet option which this also supports. DO NOT do anything funky like running encrypted RAID 0/1/5 etc. Run an ext3 (limit 16GB file size) with what ever flavor of raid you like. This will not be fast but will work. Have the VMplayer on a desktop / Laptop and point the player / workstation to the file located on the NAS box.

Question: How do you charge the battery? When I move the cursor over the battery icon it says "49% available (plugged, not charging). HELP!
Answer: Let the battery discharge itself by unplugging the 110V Power Source from the computer and let the computer drain the battery until it shuts down. (Busy yourself while this is happening) After this, Plug in the power source again and allow the battery to recharge itself. (with or without the computer operating) If the battery does not reach 100%/98% in a reasonable time, contact HP for a new battery

Question: WHAT DOES "WINDOWS 7 STARTER" MEAN?
Answer: Windows 7 Starter, the limited edition of Windows 7. The restrictions that owns this edition are: No Aero support: you can only use opaque issues and will not have the taskbar and Aero Peek Customizing the desktop: you can not change the desktop background, window colors as combinations or sound. Forget to put your background or your business corporate screen saver. Rate user: user not allowed to change without logging off and re-identify. Multi-monitor: important because due to this can be corrupted to connect to a projector, one of the things for which most laptops are used in many businesses, or simply connect your netbook to a larger screen. XP Mode: for those who want more than the ability to run Windows XP programs in Windows 7

Question: how to apply the screen protector?

Once you have it down pull on the blue strip and the top layer (which is a thicker plastic will come off. When it's on there you won't even notice it has a screen protector on it. Question: Will it load google play?
Answer: It will use google play Make sure you are connected to the Internet before you do anything. To use Google Play to download Android apps, you'll need to have a Google account with a Google email (either Gmail or a Google-hosted domain) associated with your phone or tablet. Follow these steps to add an existing Google account to your device or create a new Google account for use with Google Play: Turn on your device and tap the Google Play Store app. If you haven't added an email account to your device, you'll be prompted to "Add a Google Account." Follow the instructions on the device, which will walk you through either signing into an existing Google account or creating a new Google account. Once you have added your existing Google account or created a new account, you'll be able to use Google Play to download Android apps. Keep in mind that if you intend to purchase apps, you'll also need to make sure your Google account is set up for use with Google Wallet.

Question: when charging my powerocks the light doesn't turn from blue to green why is that?
Answer: The charge colors are as follows: Empty - LED off less than 30% charge - LED red 30-70% charge - LED green 71-100% charge - LED Blue So according to your question, the LED should never go from blue to green (if its charging). So if the LED is blue for a long period of time during charge, unplug the device from the charge cable and press the button. If the LED is blue, it is fully charged, but if the LED is green, then it has a charge between 31% and 70%. Hope this helps, and remember, you can always contact Powerocks directly and they will help troubleshoot issues with the Magicstick.

Question: I want to connect my Yamaha Motif XF to my computer wirelessly. I want to know if I can do it with this device or not?
Answer: Your Motif XF would need a USB and and ethernet port. The ywa 10 will connect your Yamaha Motif to a wireless hub wirelessly if you have the USB and ethernet port. You will have to program the ywa 10 to communicate with the wireless hub. Any devices you can access from the wireless hub including a computer should communicate over IP protocol if your Motif has this capability. If you want your device to communicate DIRECTLY with your computer rather than through your wireless hub, you would need the bluetooth adapter. Your Motif XF would have to have the connectors for the bluetooth device, i.e. connector port and USB port on the Motif and the Motif would have to be bluetooth capable etc. The bluetooth device is the ywa 11 rather than the ywa 10. The ywa 11 requires a power port and a usb port, which would have to be on the Motif XF to connect it. You also have to see from the product literature if your Motif XF can communicate with a computer via bluetooth.

Question: Will it convert 60 frames per second to 59.94 frames per second?
Answer: I haven't tested this specifically, but I'd be very surprised if it did. This isn't a scan converter/scaler/etc; it's just a HDMI-SDI converter. Dave G, who has answered this question is mistaken; the BMD TVS accepts both 60fps and 59.94fps inputs on the same setting (for instance 1080i60 will accept 1080i59.94 inputs) without any conversion, so the behavior he is experiencing is not evidence that conversion is going on. (I own 3 BMD ATEM 1 M/Es.) If you need that sort of 59.94->60fps conversion (which you don't need if you are using a Blackmagic switcher, fwiw), I would recommend a BMD UpDownCross mini converter, Grass Valley G1, or Decimator UpDownCross converter. Or any sort of scaler (TV One, Atlona, BMD Teranex, Kramer, etc etc etc). If you also need the HDMI->SDI conversion Decimator is the way to go; their little MD-Cross box is a miracle. Simultaneous SDI->HDMI and HDMI->SDI, with scaling on all inputs. The little guy does everything you'd ever want.

Question: Can someone please explain the difference between the Pentax 35mm DA L F2.4 AL lens, the Pentax DA 50mm f1.8 lens and the SMC Pentax FA 50mm f/1.4 besides the price? What does "AL", "DA" and "FA" stand for?
Answer: The major differences are the focal length (50mm and 35mm) and aperture (f2.4, 1.8 and 1.4). You may not be asking about focal length, but since there are two different focal lengths here: The focal length sets how "wide angle" or "zoomed in" you are. Bigger numbers are more "zoomed". You'll find it easier to frame a shot with 35mm than with a 50mm, especially in tight situations. These are considered standard all-around middle of the range, sizes with true wide angle at around 14mm and telephoto above 100mm. The focal length in these lenses doesn't factor much into their relative prices. What you probably really want to know. DA is a lens designed for modern digital SLRs with a smaller than full frame (35mm) sensor. Old film cameras are considered full frame. FA is designed to fill a full frame (35mm), which applies to film cameras or very expensive super-pro modern DSLRs. Unless you have one of these, you don't need the FA. AL stands for aspheric elements. This can add a bit to the price of the lens, but usually improves sharpness and other factors. Last bit of the puzzle are the apertures. Smaller numbers mean the lens can gather more light, making it possible to shoot in lower light situations (sometimes called a "faster" lens). There is a tradeoff though, shooting with a bigger aperture will shorten you depth of field, a desirable effect in some situations, but not always good for pointing and shooting. For instance, the 1.4 is a particularly big aperture. You would only be able to focus on items at a very specific distance at any given time, anything further or closer would be out of focus (look up "Bokeh"), which, again, can make for a dramatic effect. 1.4 is typically limited to only the best, most expensive lenses for discerning photographers. Overkill for the rest of us. Anyway, in sum, I have both the 35mm 2.4 and 50mm 1.8. Both are great lenses and can be found for a bargain. Either one will produce better pictures that you get with the typical kit lens. I highly recommend you buy the cheapest one you can find and try shooting with it wide open (i.e. at f2.4 or 1.8). Be sure to turn off the flash. You'll see a certain professional pop in the pictures that is hard to describe.

Question: I have never owned a SLR before.Please tell me what this lens would be used for vs the pentax DA 35mm f2.4 - would u rec 1 over the other or both? My main goals will be to shoot family photos (3 kids) and my kids sporting events (indoor and outdoor). -...
Answer: I don't have the 35mm 2.4 but I do have the 35mm 2.8 macro which I like very much (though the price difference is considerable). The 50mm is an excellent lens and is one of the first ones I grab when I go shooting. I will say though neither the 50mm or 35mm are good for sporting events of any kind. You really can't get the distance shots with either so you might want to reconsider using them for those purposes. The 50mm and 35mm are good for family photos, street photography and candid portraits. I hope that helps.

Question: Can you compare this lens with Pentax 18-55 II?
Answer: This lens and the Pentax 18-55 II are not really comparable. The 18-55 is a zoom, and the DA 50mm f1.8 is a prime, meaning, of course, no zoom. It's fixed at 50mm. Also, the 18-55 II will only open up to f3.5, so you really won't get the lovely narrow depth of field that you get with the 50mm f1.8, which is what makes this lens so attractive and seductive. So I guess it depends on what you want. The 18-55 would make a better walk-around utility lens. The 50mm f1.8 is a specialized, portrait lens that will give you a fantastically blurred background when shooting subjects up close. Personally, I think you should have both in your lens collection.

Question: Does anyone else have a problem with the screen brightness auto adjusting up and down for no reason when on battery?
Answer: Windows 8. Issue resolved for Auto-Brightness a) Press Windows Key + X, click on Control Panel. b) Click on Power Options, Click on Change Plan settings under "Preferred Plans" c) Click on "Change Advanced Power Settings". d) Select the Balanced Active option from the dropdown menu. e) Expand Display, Click on Enable Adaptive Brightness. f) Put the settings as OFF. g) Press Apply and OK. h) Restart your computer.

Question: What exactly are the perils insured against with the protection plan?
Answer: This is copied from the product page on amazon. I feel like they answer the question pretty well. Plan Features Coverage Against Accidents Accidental Damage covers any accidents that happen during normal use of the product. While most service plans cover basic mechanical malfunction only, this plan covers your Kindle Paperwhite for accidental mishaps such as drops, liquid spills, cracked screens and other human errors for up to 2 years. Please refer to the actual plan terms and conditions for a complete description of the coverages. Express Replacement Should your Kindle Paperwhite need to be replaced, we will ship a replacement unit to you along with a prepaid shipping label for you to send the defective unit back to us. No shipping fees apply. Battery Replacement One-time claim for battery malfunction in the second year of coverage. Customer Service Support Customer service support is available from 6 am to 10 pm (PST) - call (877) 441-3836. Returns & Refunds Customers may cancel their contract at any time for any reason if they have not filed a claim. If the contract is cancelled within 90 days of the date purchased and does not have a claim the customer will receive a refund of the full purchase price of the contract. If the contract is cancelled thereafter and there are no claims, the customer will be refunded the remaining days of coverage on a monthly prorated basis. No Deductibles or Shipping Fees No hidden fees, you will not be required to pay a deductible or shipping fees for claims or replacements. Your Contract will be Emailed to You After purchasing a plan you will receive your contract via email within 24 business hours and a paper copy via US mail within 7 business days. Fully Transferable Your coverage is fully transferable at no cost. Simply call (877) 441-3836 and an agent will walk you through the process. What's Covered From day one, you will have protection for accidental damage such as drops, spills or cracked screens. In the first year, the manufacturer warranty covers electrical and mechanical failures. In the second year of the Protection Plan coverage extends to cover electrical and mechanical failures, as well as a one-time claim for battery malfunction. Limitations and exclusions apply. Please refer to the actual plan terms and conditions for a complete description of the coverages.

Question: does this mount work with a sony kdl 52v5100 LCD tv?
Answer: The short answer is, yes. The wall mount is first secured to the wall. There are two arms/brackets that attach directly to the TV. The TV is then lifted and attaches and gets secured to the mount via the arms. Because they have to be able to attach to any number of different wall mountable TV's, the arms are very accommodating. In addition to the height at which the wall mount is secured, the arms will also provide some fine vertical adjustability if necessary. There is also a small amount of lateral adjustability possible. The wall mount kit includes hardware such as different screw sizes and lengths. Still, there is a possibility that the kit won't include the precise screw size/length that your TV requires. So, you might end up going to the hardware store to get the ones you need.

Question: Do you know if this clamp is compatible with Giottos QR plates?

Question: Would this be a suitable laptop for a high school student? would its irregular size be hard to manage?

Also, if you need to attach an external montior to this, look at the HDMI-VGA or HDMI-DVI-(I) converters. They'll be about $20-30 here, and don't cheap out on either. Middle of the road almost always works out well there for me. One caveat on this laptop - the keyboard is a little 'squishy' - so I do type on it quite a bit, but do NOT like it. If I had my preference, I'd have a Thinkpad T- or X- series keyboard on this laptop. Aside from that, it's an excellent laptop. Excellent screen size for spreadsheets and multiple html/web pages, programming IDEs.

Question: Newby to this type of software--what additional equipment do I need to purchase to record instrumental? Mics, etc?
Answer: There are two main ways to connect your instruments to your PC to access the software; one is to buy an audio interface; this is a very basic setup in which you can plug a guitar or instrument into the interface which then sends the data via USB to your software; you also monitor output through the interface. The second way, this is how I do it, is to buy a small mixer which has what is referred to as a "control room" section; this allows you to hook instruments, mics etc to the mixer, feed them into the computer through the PC's line in jack, and monitor the output without creating a feedback loop; I like it best because you don't have to worry about that awful latency problem, the delay between playing and hearing what you played... with this setup you can hook up as many instruments as there are inputs on the mixer; if you play keyboards at all, consider buying a midi controller keyboard, these usually require only a single USB cable to send the signal in and power the keyboard itself, and Mixcraft6 recognized my old midi controller without my having to reinstall the drivers, which was excellent... hope this wasn't too wordy to understand; bottom line, I think buying a mixer is your best bet; you can use headphones or hook it up to a stereo system and listen through speakers.

Question: new to mixcraft 6 home studio recording...but when i speak or sing into my mic,my vocals are slurred and dragging...what do i need to adjust,pls help
Answer: Sometimes slow hard drive access times can cause stuttering in recording or playback. If increasing the buffer or latency settings in the sound device preferences (File Menu > Preferences > Sound Device) doesn't help, and you have Mixcraft 6 or higher, try this: 1) In Mixcraft, click on the File menu and select Preferences. 2) Choose the Recording preferences. 3) Try switching the Recording File Type setting from "Uncompressed Wave File" to "Compressed Ogg Vorbis File." 4) Now record something and see if the problem is gone. Good Luck!

Question: All I need to do is copy and then fade songs to a CD. Dance recital stuff. Very basic...is this a good program for that simple level of recording.
Answer: You can use Mixcraft for this purpose; you would need to first rip the CD tracks you want using a secondary application; Windows Media Player can rip individual tracks from a CD; create a folder in which to save them as WAV or MP3; then you can open a new project in Mixcraft... I find it easiest to open Windows Explorer, open the folder containing the files and drag each one into a track in the Mixcraft project where it becomes a CLIP... you can then move them around and order them as desired; eventually you will want to put all the clips in one track; if you drag a clip and overlap the clip in front of it, Mixcraft automatically creates a crossfade; drag the clip back and forth to determine how much crossfade you want... then you can use one of the Mixcraft CD burning engines to burn your mix to CD... hope this helps... remember, first you need to rip the selected tracks to your hard drive using Windows Media Player, to make them available to drag into your Mixcraft project...

Answer: This is the passive model which blocks out as much noise as the padding around the ear can muffle. This is not the Noise Canceling model. Noise canceling works by sensing and canceling out noise before it gets to your ear canal. It uses batteries for this.

Question: How do you guys use this with IPcams which usually take 12V. This unit puts 48V through the cable... How/were is it regulated?
Answer: 802.3af and 802.3at PoE devices have internal voltage regulators. They may require 12v when using a DC power adapter. But, if they're powered using a PoE switch or mid-span PoE injector, they recieve a higher voltage (usually 48v) on the Category cable, then step the voltage down internally to whatever is needed. 802.3xx PoE technology allows each device manufacturer to design their equipment as they need, simply taking the "bus" voltage then dropping it using an internal voltage regulator. The supply side of the circuit sends a constant voltage, independent of the component or its needs.

Question: Has anyone tested these units with gigabit? or are they limited to 10/100 operation?
Answer: This device is the 10/100 version - since two pairs are used for data, and 2 pairs for power. There are Gigabit versions "WS-GPOE" that use transformers to share power and data - so all 4 pairs are active and gigabit rates are supported

Question: My NEX 7 doesn't recognize a new Rokinon 8mm f/2.8 UMC Fish-Eye Lens for Sony E-mount. I've followed all instructions in the manual. Any ideas?

Question: Has anybody ever compared this lens with SEL16F28 + VCLECF1 combination (Sony's fisheye converter)? I wonder if this one is superior... Thanks!
Answer: There's no comparison. The 16mm with converter is as good a substitute as you will find, but cannot hold a candle to the Rokinon. The latter is better corrected across the frame, better designed (Samyang patent), and very, very sharp. But the 16mm gives you the equivalent of a 24mm on a 35mm format - which may be a more useful combination for some shooters. I have a 16-50 PZ that covers 16mm acceptably.

Question: Version II of this lens fixes Nex-7 purple fringing issue. A6000 has similar sensor size. Does A6000 work with this lens or should I get V2?

That aside, to answer your direct question, both the NEX-7 and the A6000 have APS-C size sensors, and E (not FE) lens mounts, so there should be no question that either the original version or the updated version will attach physically, and will have a large enough image circle to fully cover the sensor on either camera.

Question: I've heard this lens is manual, Ive never owned a manual lens, is it hard to use?

Question: Will this lens work on the Sony A5100? Thanks!

Several sellers carry these and they are a real secret bargain. It will be cropped to 12mm on your camera just like mine and will capture not overly distorted, very pleasant images. Very versatile, compact, very well built lens, really sharp edge-to-edge with great colors. The distance calibration is totally off on my camera, before use it first check out on your lcd screen with a focus assistance where the infinity really is and mark it. On my Fuji at 4ft. The depth of field is so great, I just prefocus roughly between 2 and 3 feet inside and between 3 and 4 ft. outside, depends on the subject and get everything in focus at f8. I loooooove this amazing lil' piece of glass and I hope you will.

Question: Can the Rokinon 8mm Fisheye lens work with Sony A7? And it is for manual focus only, right?
Answer: Hello Chong Ho Yu, yes the Rokinon 8mm Fisheye lens will work on the A7 (and the A7R and A7S). However, the usefulness of the lens is somewhat limited on the A7 bodies because this lens was designed for a crop-sensor camera (smaller imaging circle) such as the A6000, A5000, or the older NEX-branded bodies. To use the lens on the A7 bodies (which have full frame sensors) you have two choices: use the lens in 'crop mode', which automatically crops the image in-camera (convenient) but only yields a 10 MP image on the A7, 15 MP on the A7R, or roughly 5 MP on the A7S; your other option is to use the full imaging circle (you can easily set this in-camera), but be aware that the resulting image will have a large black circular border (vignette). The lens is not ideally suited for the A7 bodies, since you're not leveraging the full frame imaging circle, but is still a useful (and reasonably priced) option. And, yes, it is manual focus only. Hope this helps.

Question: I did not get any instructions! How do you bind this thing?
Answer: Its very simple to use. It has a limited memory so it can only hold enough info to remember 5 devices. When the device is on and you double click the button it will erase all its memory and previous pairings. To connect with a device is simple. When turning on the device hold for 3 seconds and the device button will start to blink with a blue light. Just to reconfirmed, through this whole entire procedure you are holding the button continuously for about 5 to 8 seconds.

Question: Is it possible that this is both transmitter and receiver? One person says: This is a transmitter; Another person says: it is not a transmitter?
Answer: No, it is not possible this is a transmitter at all. It is a receiver. I fell for the same comments when I selected to purchase this device. I received it and it didn't do either, so I contacted the seller about it not transmitting or receiving and the seller told me it's only a receiver and not a transmitter. Those claiming it's a transmitter are making comments about the wrong device or a similar device used to transmit and now only receives or they received the wrong device or they're simply wrong. This is not a transmitter. And, frankly, it's not that great of a receiver for the price. After receiving my replacement, I tried it out and then gave it away, because I found a better one for around $2.50.

Question: my router only has one ethernet port which hooks up to my computer tower, my blu ray system is in another room, will this product work for me?
Answer: You probably do not have a router if it only has one port, you may be talking about the modem. you should invest in a router which will add more ports to your modem first. this product does not add additional ports, it simply connects to 1 existing port. once it is connected and plugged into a power outlet, it converts it to a signal that will run through your home's power lines. this is where the second unit comes into play. when you plug in the second unit it will grab the signal and convert it again so that it will be usable with your Ethernet enabled device.

Question: i have a pair that no longer syncs together. anyone know of an easy way to re-sync or re-pair them to work?
Answer: To restore factory defaults: With the device plugged into an electrical outlet you will need to press and hold the Security button on the bottom of the device for 15 seconds. To change the encryption key on a PWR500 Powerline Adapter: To reset and change the encryption key on the PWR500, follow the steps below: 1. Plug the Adapters into electrical outlets on the same circuit. 2. Press and hold the Security button on each unit one at a time for exactly 10 seconds. On the 10th second, let go of the button. When you release the button, the Power LED's will turn off very briefly and turn back on. The LK LED's will not turn back on at this time. 3. Then on one of the units, press and hold the Security button for exactly 3 seconds. On the 3rd second, release the button. When you release the button, the Power LED will begin to flash. 4. Now on the other unit, press and hold the Security button for exactly 3 seconds. On the 3rd second, release the button. When you release the button, the Power LED will turn off and back on breifly, and then the LK LED should be lit on both units. Provided the LK lights on both units are lit, the encryption key has been changed and the two Adapters are now connected on the same Powerline network with a new encryption key.

Question: Does this headset go into or on top of your ears. In other words can you use this device if you wear hearing aids?

Question: what the difference between this and the irdt200?
Answer: Tuner Pro has firmware that will support integration with third party apps and systems - i.e. it can be controlled by and provide media metadata to other control systems. The non-pro line MAY have SOME current capability, but there is no commitment to continue the same level of third party integration in the non-pro line. Bottom line: If you have a Crestron, Control4, AMX, etc. automation system - get the Pro; if not - skip the pro.

Question: Can only Open Mesh devices join the mesh network. Say I have another wireless router or a repeater; can these be added on?
Answer: Other devices, like a wireless router/bridge/repeater, can connect to the network just like any other client device can. They will not be members of the mesh itself though in terms of routing or control. They would just be acting as a typical client device. So, you could hook up another repeater, but it would not be managed as part of the mesh and you would need to have it set to a different SSID from the mesh's. Basically, it's a matter of whether or not the router has internal support for the batman-adv protocol layer (and, no, this isn't a joke -- B.A.T.M.A.N. is an acronym for "Better Approach To Mobile Adhoc Networking"). If you really know what you are doing and your secondary routers support running the OpenWrt firmware, then you could possibly load batman-adv into the router and add it to an existing Mesh as a true node. That said, this is a lot of work and you REALLY need to know what you are doing -- and you will have to configure your router from the Linux shell interface. So, if you aren't up to using SSH and VI to edit the raw config files on your router, this probably isn't something to even think about.

Question: Are these as fast with lots of users on them compared to connecting a few nice wireless routers to the modem via ethernet to serve users in apt units?
Answer: Yes, if your ultimate goal is to ensure that all users are "as fast as" each other. Ultimately, the speed is limited by the maximum bandwidth your ISP provides. This modem has a feature for you to limit the maximum bandwidth that each user can use. This feature is very important and useful because no one single user can "hog" most bandwidth and cause other users to slow down dramatically.

Question: One reviewer stated that in order to use zone 2 the receiver must be in party mode. Is that correct?

You can have Zone 1 playing a movie on 7.2 Surround while Zone 2 can be listening to the Radio or playing from other sources (some limitations apply, so you need to read the User Manual for details). Party Mode is used to listen to the same source on both Zone 1 and 2 at the same time. Typical use would be listening to Radio or internet on all speakers when you have a party at home (hence the name "Party Mode").

Question: IS MODEL 1020 A MULTI VOLTAGE 110/220 VOLTS UNIT?

Only the "US" model can receive HD radio; RDS tuning is in the US and Europe models only; traffic info via FM is in Europe and UK models only; the remote control has programmable learning instead of codes for other remotes in the "China, Korea, UK and Europe models only". Download the instruction manual from Yamaha and read carefully to pick up these differences.

Question: would like to use this to power 3 zones - 2 sets of speakers each in zone 2 and zone 3. what else do I need for zones 2/3?
Answer: i have this receiver and love it. I power 3 zones with it. All you need is speakers for zone 2 and 3. No additional amplifiers needed as all 3 zones are powered by the receiver itself. if you run 2 sets of speakers per zone, make sure your speakers have an impedance matching the receivers impedance. Do your research about how to connect them to not generate the wrong impedance. Connect speakers in series: add up impedance and you are on the safe side. If your wiring does not allow to connect them in series, make sure each of the 2 speakers you connect in parallel have double the impedance than the minimum impedance your receiver can support. Example: minimum impedance 8Ohms means you could either run 2 speakers each 4 ohms or higher in series (totals to 8 Ohms or higher) OR 2 speakers 16 ohms or higher in parallel (totals 8 ohms or higher).

Question: Does the adaptor stay in place? Is it compatable with an iphone4s? Does it charge at the same time that it plays music?
Answer: I'm not sure what you mean by the adaptor. The charger stays firmly in place in the power socket, and the cords attach firmly. The FM transmitter stays in place when attached to the MP3 player (or phone). It does swivel, but that's not an issue. Since it attaches where you plug in headphones, it is a universal device. You can attach it to anything that will take a headphone plug. The charger has a USB connection that is separate from where the cord for the transmitter connects, so you can charge a device at the same time you're using the transmitter, though I've never tried this. However, the charger does not charge your device through the transmitter itself. You do have to connect to the charger with a separate cord to do this. I hope this helps you.

Question: Anyone know what the difference is between this Sena SM10 and the Sena SR10 that's on Amazon?
Answer: The SM10 is a STEREO Bluetooth transmitting device! You'll get audio quality out of the SM10. While, the SR10 is a radio transceiver/mono-audio Bluetooth transmitting device. You'd use the SR10 to connect with Bluetooth to a CB radio. Both of the devices connect well to the SENA SMH10 motorcycle helmet head-set.

Question: How does this work with the 2013 Goldwing CB? Can I hear/speak using my SMH10 headset?
Answer: I use the SMH10 headset to communicate (talk/listen) with other headsets as if the SM10-01 were not present. I use the SM10-01 to listen to the GW audio output cable that is plugged into the SM10-01. This provides the GW with an audio output cable (radio, gps, CB) to bluetooth transmission which can be monitored with the SMH10 headsets. While you should be able to listen to the CB, this setup does not provide the 2-way bluetooth link required to use the GW intercom or mic/keying of a CB.

Question: Does this work with any other headsset than the sena, I have a LG Tone 730 that I use for my phone
